page.title: 13THE PLOUGH INN, NORTH KYME
page.content: The pub is over 150 years old.There were two pubs next door to each other but one is now a shop.The pub is in what used to be the market square. It is now managed by Mr & Mrs C.McKensie. Most customers are local with some passing trade espescially for meals which are served in the upstairs dining room or basket meals in the lounge.They get most of their beers etc.from Manns Brewery in London.Other drinks and food are got from Lincoln.They have a music box and a one-armed bandit machine,a pool table and a dart-board.There are two pool teams and two dart teams who play in the sleaford + District League.There is a car park and play area for children.
